channel.title: Feeds.bbci.co.uk on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race
channel.description: Recent content in Feeds.bbci.co.uk on Daytona 500 | The Great American Race

item.title: 'Half of my friends were killed' - the girls returning to a school caught up in war
item.description: Twins whose classmates were killed by shelling say their deaths have made them determined to finish their studies.

item.title: 'This is horrifying' - Minneapolis residents reel from second deadly shooting
item.description: Two people have been shot dead by federal agents in the city in recent weeks, leaving many angry and frustrated.

item.title: Analysing the Minneapolis shooting frame by frame
item.description: BBC Verify has analysed footage of the shooting from multiple angles, piecing together a detailed picture of what happened.

item.title: As the world inches back to a pre-WW2 order, the 'middle powers' face a grave new challenge
item.description: With economic stagnation and extremes of inequality comes corrosion of trust in democratic institutions. So Trump may be a symptom, not a cause, of what Carney called a “rupture” with the post-WW2 order.

item.title: Climber Alex Honnold scales 101-floor skyscraper without safety gear
item.description: Alex Honnold has become the first person to climb the Taiwanese building alone without safety equipment.

item.title: Cosmetic doctor sorry for picking apart singer Troye Sivan's looks on TikTok
item.description: The singer hit out at Dr Zayn Khalid Majeed - who says he will try to have a positive impact with his content.

item.title: Could trilateral talks yield a breakthrough in Ukraine-Russia war?
item.description: It’s the first time representatives from Kyiv, Moscow and Washington have come together since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: Cyclist wins Australia race despite being knocked off by Kangaroo
item.description: Australian Jay Vine wins the Tour Down Under - despite being knocked off his bike in a crash caused by a kangaroo.

item.title: Fifteen dead after Philippines ferry with 300 passengers sinks
item.description: The local coast guard is still searching for 28 missing passengers of the MV Trisha Kerstin.

item.title: Four attacks in 48 hours: How east Australia's beaches became a 'perfect storm' for sharks
item.description: Human-shark encounters in Australia are rising - but experts are keen to point out it isn’t the animals’ fault.

item.title: Heatwave warnings across Australia as millions celebrate national day
item.description: Temperatures are expected to peak on Tuesday, reaching the “high forties” in Victoria and South Australia.

item.title: How Soviet urban planning is helping Russia freeze Ukraine
item.description: Thousands of people are affected when heating plants are targeted by Russian forces.

item.title: Kenya's ex-deputy president alleges assassination attempt in church attack
item.description: The interior minister condemned the attack, which police say they are investigating.

item.title: Minneapolis protesters march against ICE as governor urges Trump to remove agents
item.description: Second fatal shooting an ‘inflection point’ says Tim Walz as protests spread over Saturday’s shooting of intensive care nurse Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

item.title: Party backed by generals set for landslide as 'sham' Myanmar election ends
item.description: Many parties were banned and there was no voting in about half the country which is gripped by fear and civil war.

item.title: People cling to treetops as 'worst floods in a generation' sweep Mozambique
item.description: The worst flooding in a generation hits Mozambique with teams from Brazil, South Africa and the UK helping with the rescue.

item.title: Russia using Interpol's wanted list to target critics abroad, leak reveals
item.description: A leak exposes for the first time the extent of Russia’s misuse of Interpol to request the arrest of critics.

item.title: Sir Mark Tully, the BBC's 'voice of India', dies aged 90
item.description: Sir Mark covered some of the defining moments in India’s history in a career that spanned decades.

item.title: Tearful goodbyes as Japan returns pandas to China amid worsening ties
item.description: The twin cubs’ departure will leave Japan without any pandas for the first time since 1972.

item.title: Tragic chapter on the trains sends rail superpower Spain into crisis
item.description: Spain’s vaunted reputation for its high-speed network has been humbled by disaster on the railways.

item.title: Trump says UK soldiers in Afghanistan 'among greatest of all warriors'
item.description: The US president’s praise follows his claim that allied forces avoided the front lines during the Afghanistan conflict.

item.title: Venezuela frees dozens of political prisoners, human rights group says
item.description: It is the latest batch of detainees freed since the US seized Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in a raid.

item.title: Watch: BBC at protests near scene where Alex Pretti was shot dead
item.description: Protesters chanted Alex Pretti’s name after he became the second person this month to be shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis.

item.title: What India's Republic Day red carpet means for its foreign policy
item.description: Who sits beside India’s president on Republic Day signals Delhi’s diplomatic priorities to the world.

item.title: What we know about fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Trump officials says federal agents shot in self-defence, as Pretti’s parents accuse them of “sickening lies”.

item.title: Who was Alex Pretti, the intensive care nurse shot dead in Minneapolis?
item.description: He has been described as an avid outdoorsman who loved mountain biking.

item.title: Winter storm grips US as millions face power outages and disruption
item.description: A powerful winter storm swept across the country, with heavy snow, ice and dangerously low temperatures affecting millions.
